title: How to Make a Flower from a Cigarette

steps.headline: Remove the tobacco from the paper by lightly twisting and pushing it out.
steps.description: Pull any strands or chunks out to make it easier.

steps.headline: Tap the paper on a surface or squeeze the paper like a toothpaste tube to make sure everything is out.
Remove the cigarette filter by pinching and rubbing the filter part.
steps.description: Pull it out as a whole.

steps.headline: Fan out the filter.
steps.description: Grab the filter with one hand. With the other hand, break into the filter by fanning out the strands into "petals". Push the "petals" downwards against the fingers on the hand that is holding it to spread it out more.

steps.headline: Create the flower stem.
steps.description: Take the empty cigarette and start twisting & rolling the paper in a thin line. Roll about 1/4 to 1/2 of the filter part with it.

steps.headline: Put it together.
steps.description: Place the filter paper back into the filter part so that the petals stick out.

steps.headline: Secure them together.
steps.description: Twist and roll a tiny section of where the paper is located inside the filter. This ensures that the petals will stay in.

steps.headline: Finish your flower.
steps.description: Flatten the petals on a surface to widen them out.

text: Remove the tobacco from the paper by lightly twisting and pushing it out. Pull any strands or chunks out to make it easier. Tap the paper on a surface or squeeze the paper like a toothpaste tube to make sure everything is out.  Remove the cigarette filter by pinching and rubbing the filter part. Pull it out as a whole. Fan out the filter. Grab the filter with one hand. With the other hand, break into the filter by fanning out the strands into "petals". Push the "petals" downwards against the fingers on the hand that is holding it to spread it out more. Create the flower stem. Take the empty cigarette and start twisting & rolling the paper in a thin line. Roll about 1/4 to 1/2 of the filter part with it. Put it together. Place the filter paper back into the filter part so that the petals stick out. Secure them together. Twist and roll a tiny section of where the paper is located inside the filter. This ensures that the petals will stay in. Finish your flower. Flatten the petals on a surface to widen them out.
